page.title: 06INDUSTRY 2. BRICKMAKING
page.content: The largest employer within this block is the brickworks at Todhill, run by STEETLEY BRICKS LTD.( 150 approx.). Brickmaking was often associated with mining because of the sedimentary clay found in coal measures; sand for re_ fractory bricks, shale or heavy clays for engineering bricks. As the mines closed Steetley, whose HQ is at Newcastle under Lyme, took over the brick making operations in the old colliery railway sheds at the place where the donkey engines hauled up the coals from the drift-mines in the river valley. Raw-materials suitable for bricks are still readily available hence the quarries at Newfield. Steetley still produce eng.bricks from local shales, plus many domestic types inc quality facing & "hand-made". The BSC.,Newfield plant for ref-bricks now closed: recession in steel making.
